discover.instruction: Read about this family. Notice the highlighted words before nouns.
discover.instruction_ru: Прочитай о семье. Обрати внимание на выделенные слова перед существительными.

content.text: Hello! <highlight>My</highlight> name is Kate. This is <highlight>my</highlight> family. <highlight>My</highlight> mother is a teacher. <highlight>Her</highlight> name is Anna. <highlight>My</highlight> father is a doctor. <highlight>His</highlight> name is Tom. They love <highlight>their</highlight> jobs. I have a brother. <highlight>His</highlight> name is Jack. <highlight>Our</highlight> house is in London. Jack has a dog. <highlight>Its</highlight> name is Max. What's <highlight>your</highlight> name? Tell me about <highlight>your</highlight> family!
content.question: What do these highlighted words tell us about?
content.question_ru: О чём нам говорят выделенные слова?

points.example: I have a car. My car is red.
You have a book. Your book is new.

points.rule: he → his, she → her, it → its
points.rule_ru: he → his, she → her, it → its (его/её)
points.example: He is Tom. His house is big. She is Anna. Her car is blue.
We have a dog. Our dog is friendly. They have a cat. Their cat is lazy.

notice.instruction: Find all possessive adjectives and identify who owns what.
notice.instruction_ru: Найди все притяжательные прилагательные и определи, кому что принадлежит.

tasks.text: This is my classroom. Our teacher is Mrs. Brown. Her desk is near the window. She has a computer on her desk. My friend Tom sits next to me. His notebook is blue. My notebook is green. We share our pencils. The classroom has its own projector. The students like their classroom. What about your classroom? Is your teacher nice?

notice.reflection_question: What's the difference between 'he' and 'his'? Between 'she' and 'her'?
notice.reflection_question_ru: В чём разница между 'he' и 'his'? Между 'she' и 'her'?

exercises.instruction: Complete with the correct possessive adjective.

questions.sentence: Tom is tall. ___ hair is brown.
Maria is a teacher. ___ students like her.
We have a cat. ___ name is Fluffy.
I am a student. ___ school is near here.
The children are playing with ___ toys.

sentences.explanation: its (possessive) has no apostrophe; it's = it is

produce.instruction: Describe your family using possessive adjectives.
produce.instruction_ru: Опиши свою семью, используя притяжательные прилагательные.
prompts: Your mother: her name, her job, her hobbies
Your father: his name, his job, his hobbies
Your siblings: their names, their interests
Your family together: our home, our traditions
produce.example: My mother is Maria. Her job is teaching. She loves her work. My father is Tom. His hobby is gardening. My parents love their house. Our home is always warm and welcoming.

input_flood.description: Read 5 texts with many possessive adjectives.

texts.title: My Best Friend
texts.content: My best friend is Sarah. Her eyes are blue. Her hair is long. She loves her family. Her mother is kind. Her father works a lot. I often visit her house. Our friendship is strong. We share our secrets. Her dog loves me too. Its name is Buddy.

texts.title: The Office
texts.content: I work in an office. My desk is near the window. My boss is nice. Her name is Ms. Smith. My colleagues are friendly. Their desks are next to mine. We love our coffee breaks. The office has its own kitchen. What about your work?

texts.title: Pets
texts.content: I have two pets. My cat is Whiskers. Its fur is soft. My dog is Max. His tail is always wagging. They have their own beds. My sister loves her rabbit. Its ears are long. Our pets are part of our family.

texts.title: Classroom
texts.content: This is our classroom. Our teacher is kind. Her lessons are interesting. My seat is in the front. My friend sits behind me. His notes are always neat. Their group projects are creative. The school has its own library.

texts.title: New Neighbors
texts.content: We have new neighbors. Their family is big. The father is tall. His name is John. The mother is friendly. Her smile is beautiful. Their children play with my brother. Our dogs are friends too. Its nice to have good neighbors.

grammar_cards.front:
The cat is eating ___ food.
(it's / its)
grammar_cards.back:
its

its = possessive
it's = it is

grammar_cards.front:
Find the error:
"They love they children."
grammar_cards.back:
They love their children.

they → their

common_errors: Confusing subject and possessive (she vs her)
